Question_2.Context: Farnesoid X receptor (FXR) is a nuclear receptor that plays a crucial role in the homeostasis and enterohepatic circulation of bile acids. It is also involved in the regulation of lipid and glucose metabolism.
Question_2.Question: Which receptor is known to be involved in the homeostasis of bile acids?
Question_2.Source: Farnesoid X receptor (FXR) is the crucial nuclear receptor expressed mainly in the liver and intestine which involves in the homeostasis and enterohepatic circulation of BAs.

Question_8.Context: The enterohepatic circulation of bile acids involves their secretion into the bile duct, storage in the gallbladder, release into the small intestine, and reabsorption into the systemic circulation.
Question_8.Question: What is the enterohepatic circulation of bile acids?
Question_8.A: The process by which bile acids are synthesized and excreted in the urine
Question_8.B: The circulation of bile acids from the liver to the gallbladder and then to the small intestine
Question_8.C: The cycle of bile acids being secreted into the bile duct, stored, released into the intestine, and reabsorbed into the circulation
Question_8.D: The conversion of primary bile acids into secondary bile acids by the liver
Question_8.Source: All BAs that are reabsorbed into the systemic circulation enter into the liver and involve in the entero- hepatic circulation.
